'''Halfast "Hal" Gamgee''' was a [[Hobbits|Hobbit]] of [[the Shire]].

==History==
Halfast was the son of [[Halfred of Overhill|Halfred]], an uncle of [[Samwise Gamgee]].<ref>{{App|Gamgee}}</ref> He worked for [[Boffin Family|Mr. Boffin]] in [[Overhill]], and often went up in the [[Northfarthing]] to hunt. 

He had the reputation for his wild stories of things he saw. He reportedly encountered a "[[Tree-men|Tree-man]]" while hunting beyond the [[North Moors]].

Sam mentioned this gossip to [[Ted Sandyman]] while discussing the queer news heard in [[the Shire]] around {{TA|3018}}.<ref>{{FR|Shadow}}</ref>

==Etymology==
The name likely comes from [[Old English]] ''hālfæst'' meaning "hale and firm".<ref>{{HM|IE}}, "Giving of Names"</ref>
